question: Which of the following would you prefer?

choices.text: 33% chance to win $2500, 66% chance to win $2400, 1% chance to win nothing
choices.response: You chose the higher but less certain gain.
You chose the certain but smaller gain.

answer: Most people (82%) chose the certain gain even though the gamble has a higher mathematical value. People are risk-averse concerning gains.

question: Which of the following would you prefer?

choices.text: 33% chance to win $2500, 67% chance to win nothing
choices.response: You chose the higher but less certain gain.

choices.text: 34% chance to win $2400, 66% chance to win nothing
choices.response: You chose the more certain but smaller gain.

answer: Most people (83%) chose the higher gain even though the second option has a higher probability. Note that this question is the same as the previous one except that a 66% chance to win $2400 has been removed from both options. Many people reverse their choice despite this equivalence.

question: Which of the following would you prefer?

choices.response: You chose to embrace risk to avoid a loss.

answer: Most people (92%) chose the gamble to avoid a certain loss even though the second option is a lower net loss. Most people are risk-seeking concerning losses even though they are risk-averse concerning gains.
